get.description: Use this endpoint to request a list of Projects in your Wistia account. This request supports paging and sorting.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of projects per page

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Ordering

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Ordering Sort Direction (0 = desc, 1 = asc; default is 1)

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

publicId.description: If the project is public, this field contains a string representing the ID used for referencing the project in public URLs.

post.description: Create a new project. If the project is created successfully the Location HTTP header will point to the new project.

name.description: The name of the project you want to create.

adminEmail.description: The email address of the person you want to set as the owner of this project. Defaults to the Wistia Account Owner.

oneOf.description: A flag indicating whether or not the project is enabled for public access. Set to “1” to enable and “0” to disable.
A flag indicating whether or not the project is enabled for public access. Set to `true` to enable and `false` to disable.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

publicId.description: If the project is public, this field contains a string representing the ID used for referencing the project in public URLs.

get.description: Retrieve a single project. Projects#show uses pagination by default - we’ll return up to the first 500 medias in a Project. If you have more than 500 medias in a Project, you’ll need to add a query param, page=2 to get the second page of medias (and the third, etc.). You can check how many pages you will need by looking at the media_count in your first request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project Hashed ID

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.
A unique numeric identifier for the media within the system.

name.description: The display name of the media.

type.description: A string representing what type of media this is.

archived.description: Whether or not the media is archived, either true or false.

created.description: The date when the media was originally uploaded.

updated.description: The date when the media was last changed.

duration.description: Specifies the length (in seconds) for audio and video files. Specifies number of pages in the document. Omitted for other types of media.

hashed_id.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this media.

description.description: A description for the media which usually appears near the top of the sidebar on the media’s page.

progress.description: A floating point value between 0 and 1 that indicates the progress of the processing for this file.

status.description: Post upload processing status. - `queued`: the file is waiting in the queue to be processed. - `processing`: the file is actively being processed. - `ready`: the file has been fully processed and is ready for embedding and viewing. - `failed`: the file was unable to be processed (usually a format or size error).

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

publicId.description: If the project is public, this field contains a string representing the ID used for referencing the project in public URLs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project Hashed ID

anonymousCanUpload.description: Whether anonymous users can upload media to the project.

anonymousCanDownload.description: Whether anonymous users can download media from the project.

oneOf.description: A flag indicating whether or not the project is enabled for public access. Set to “1” to enable and “0” to disable.
A flag indicating whether or not the project is enabled for public access. Set to `true` to enable and `false` to disable.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

publicId.description: If the project is public, this field contains a string representing the ID used for referencing the project in public URLs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project Hashed ID

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

post.description:
This method does not copy the project’s sharing information (i.e. users that could see the old project will not automatically be able to see the new one).
For the request you can specify the owner of a new project by passing an optional parameter. The person you specify must be a Manager in the account.
For the response, the HTTP Location header will be set to the URL where the new project resource resides. The body of the response will contain an object representing the new copy of the project that was just created.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Project Hashed ID

adminEmail.description: The email address of the account Manager that will be the owner of the new project. Defaults to the Account Owner if invalid or omitted.

Location.description: The URL where the new project resource resides.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

mediaCount.description: The number of different medias that have been uploaded to the project.

created.description: The date that the project was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the project was last updated.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

public.description: A boolean indicating whether the project is available for public (anonymous) viewing.

publicId.description: If the project is public, this field contains a string representing the ID used for referencing the project in public URLs.

get.description:
A sharing is an object that links either a contact or a contact group to a project, including information about the contacts' permissions to that project.
Retrieve a list of all sharings for a given project. Supports paging and sorting.

parameters.name: project-id
parameters.description: Project Hashed ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of projects per page

post.description: Create a new sharing object for a project by specifying the email of the person to share with and other optional parameters.

parameters.name: project-id
parameters.description: Hashed ID of the project to be shared

with.description: The email address of the person with whom you want to share the project.

oneOf.description: Default is "1". Set to "0" to allow access without a password.
A flag indicating whether or not a password is required.
Default is "0". Set to "1" to allow the user to share the project with others.
Whether the user is allowed to share the project with others.
Default is "0". Set to "1" to allow the user to download files from the project.
Whether the user is allowed to download files from the project.
Default is "0". Set to "1" to allow the user to upload files to the project.
Whether the user is allowed to upload files to the project.

sendEmailNotification.description: Deprecated! Email notifications are always sent now.

Location.description: The API endpoint for the new sharing object.

schema.description: The response includes a link for the user to access the project.

items.description: Error message detailing the reason for the bad request.

example: email@example.com is already shared on this project.

get.description: Retrieve the details of a specific sharing object for a given project.

parameters.name: project-id
parameters.description: Hashed ID for the project for which you'd like to see sharings.

parameters.name: sharing-id
parameters.description: The ID of the specific sharing object that you want to see.

put.description: Update a sharing on a project

parameters.name: project-id
parameters.description: ID of the project

parameters.name: sharing-id
parameters.description: ID of the sharing to be updated

canShare.description: Allow the user or group to share the project with others.

canDownload.description: Allow the user or group to download media from the project.

canUpload.description: Allow the user or group to upload media to the project.

isAdmin.description: Give this user admin rights to the project.

delete.description: Delete a sharing on a project

parameters.name: project-id
parameters.description: Hashed ID of the project

parameters.name: sharing-id
parameters.description: ID of the sharing to be deleted

get.description: Obtain a list of all the media in your account. For accounts with more than 100 media, you’ll want to page and sort the returned list.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of medias per page

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Ordering

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Ordering Sort Direction (0 = desc, 1 = asc; default is 1)

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: A hashed ID specifying the project from which you would like to get results.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Find a media or medias whose name exactly matches this parameter.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A string specifying which type of media you would like to get.

parameters.name: hashed_id
parameters.description: Find the media by hashed_id.

parameters.name: hashed_ids[]
parameters.description: Find all of the medias by these hashed_ids.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Find all of the medias that match all of these tag names.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Filter by archived status. True will return only archived medias, while false will return only active medias.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the media within the system.

name.description: The display name of the media.

type.description: A string representing what type of media this is.

archived.description: Whether or not the media is archived, either true or false.

created.description: The date when the media was originally uploaded.

updated.description: The date when the media was last changed.

duration.description: Specifies the length (in seconds) for audio and video files. Specifies number of pages in the document. Omitted for other types of media.

embedCode.description: DEPRECATED: If you want to programmatically embed videos, follow the construct an embed code guide.

hashed_id.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this media.

description.description: A description for the media which usually appears near the top of the sidebar on the media’s page.

progress.description: A floating point value between 0 and 1 that indicates the progress of the processing for this file.

status.description: Post upload processing status. - `queued`: the file is waiting in the queue to be processed. - `processing`: the file is actively being processed. - `ready`: the file has been fully processed and is ready for embedding and viewing. - `failed`: the file was unable to be processed (usually a format or size error).

section.description: The title of the section in which the media appears. This attribute is omitted if the media is not in a section (default).

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

assets.description: An array of the assets available for this media.

url.description: A direct-access URL to the content of the asset.

width.description: The width of this specific asset, if applicable.

height.description: The height of this specific asset, if applicable.

fileSize.description: The size of the asset file that’s referenced by url, measured in bytes.

type.description: The internal type of the asset, describing how the asset should be used. Values can include OriginalFile, FlashVideoFile, MdFlashVideoFile, HdFlashVideoFile, Mp4VideoFile, MdMp4VideoFile, HdMp4VideoFile, IPhoneVideoFile, StillImageFile, SwfFile, Mp3AudioFile, and LargeImageFile.

get.description:
Get information about a specific piece of media. Fetch detailed information about a specific piece of media you’ve uploaded to your account using its hashed_id.

CDN-backed medias are accessible using this url structure: https://fast.wistia.com/embed/medias/{hashed_id}.m3u8.
For more information, see https://docs.wistia.com/docs/asset-urls#getting-hls-assets.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media.

name.description: The display name of the media.

type.description: A string representing what type of media this is.

updated.description: The date when the media was last changed.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media.

new_still_media_id.description: The Wistia hashed ID of an image that will replace the still that’s displayed before the player starts playing.

description.description: A new description for this media. Accepts plain text or markdown.

tags.description: An array of tag names to apply to the media. Note that this will replace any existing tags!

project_id.description: The ID of the project where you want the new copy placed. Defaults to the source media’s current project if omitted or invalid.

owner.description: An email address specifying the owner of the new media. Defaults to the source media’s current owner if omitted or invalid.

201.description: Successful creation of the media copy.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the project within the system.

hashedId.description: A private hashed id, uniquely identifying the project within the system.

get.description: Aggregated tracking statistics for a video embedded on your site.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the video.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the video within the system.

hashed_id.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the video within the system.

name.description: The display name of the video.

stats.description: An object representing the aggregated embed statistics for this video.

pageLoads.description: The total number of times that the page containing the embedded video has been loaded.

visitors.description: The number of unique visitors to the page containing the embedded video.

percentOfVisitorsClickingPlay.description: An integer between 0 and 100 that shows what percentage of the time someone who saw the page containing the embedded video played the video.

plays.description: The total number of times that the video has been played.

averagePercentWatched.description: An integer between 0 and 100. It shows the average percentage of the video that was watched over every time the video was played.

error.description: Error message detailing the reason for the bad request.

put.description: This method accepts a list of up to 100 medias to archive per request. It processes requests asynchronously and will return a background_job_status object rather than the typical Media response object. Note that Livestream medias and Soapbox videos imported to Wistia before September 1, 2023 cannot be archived.

parameters.name: hashed_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of the media hashed IDs to be archived. Each hashed ID must be passed as a separate parameter.

message.description: A confirmation message that the background job has been queued.

id.description: The ID of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

status.description: The status of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

put.description: Restore archived medias to your account. This method accepts a list of up to 100 medias to restore per request. It processes requests asynchronously and will return a background_job_status object rather than the typical Media response object. Your account must have access to the Archiving feature to use this method.

parameters.name: hashed_ids[]
parameters.description: An array of the media hashed IDs to be restored. Each hashed ID must be passed as a separate parameter. The brackets [] in the hashed_ids param must be URL encoded if the param is being passed as part of the query string or if it’s being passed in the request body and the Content-Type request header is NOT application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the project to restore the medias to. Required unless channel_id is specified.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the channel to restore the medias to. Required unless project_id is specified.

message.description: A confirmation message that the background job has been queued.

type.description: The type of container the medias will be restored to, either Project or Channel.

name.description: The display name of the container the medias will be restored to.

hashedId.description: The hashed ID of the container the medias will be restored to.

id.description: The ID of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

status.description: The status of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

422.description: Missing arguments for restoration of media.

error.description: An error message that the necessary parameters were not provided.
error.example: Incorrect number of parameters provided. Provide one project_id or one channel_id.

id.description: Numeric id of the account

mediaCount.description: The total number of medias in this account

projectCount.description: The total number of projects in this account

channelCount.description: The total number of channels in this account

get.description: Retrieve the status of a background job.

parameters.name: background-job-status-id
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the background job

id.description: The ID of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

status.description: The status of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

403.description: Background Job Status Not Associated with An Authorized Object

error.example: The requested background job status is not associated with an authorized object.

get.description: Fetches explicitly defined customizations for the video.

parameters.name: media-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the video.

playerColor.description: The color of the video player.

autoPlay.description: Whether the video should auto play or not.

endVideoBehavior.description: Behavior of the video at the end.

playButton.description: Indicates if the play button is visible.

post.description: Set customizations for a video. Replaces the customizations explicitly set for this video.

parameters.name: media-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the video.

autoPlay.description: If set to true, the video will play as soon as it’s ready. Note that autoplay might not work on some devices and browsers.

controlsVisibleOnLoad.description: If set to true, controls like the big play button, playbar, volume, etc. will be visible as soon as the video is embedded.

copyLinkAndThumbnailEnabled.description: If set to false, the option to “Copy Link and Thumbnail” will be removed when right-clicking on the video.

doNotTrack.description: If set to true, data for each viewing session will not be tracked.

email.description: Associate a specific email address with this video’s viewing sessions.

endVideoBehavior.description: Determines what happens when the video ends. Options are default (stays on the last frame), reset (shows thumbnail and controls), and loop (plays again from the start).

fakeFullscreen.description: If set to true, the video will try to play in a pseudo-fullscreen mode on certain mobile devices.

fitStrategy.description: Resizes the video when there's a discrepancy between its aspect ratio and that of its parent container. Options are contain, cover, fill, and none.

fullscreenButton.description: If set to true, the fullscreen button will be available as a video control.

fullscreenOnRotateToLandscape.description: If set to false, the video will not automatically go to fullscreen mode on mobile when rotated to landscape.

keyMoments.description: If set to false, the key moments feature will be disabled.

muted.description: If set to true, the video will start in a muted state.

playbackRateControl.description: If set to false, the playback speed controls in the settings menu will be hidden.

playbar.description: If set to true, the playbar will be available. If set to false, it will be hidden.

playButton.description: Indicates if the play button is visible.

playerColor.description: Changes the base color of the player. Expects a hexadecimal rgb string.

playlistLinks.description: Enables the use of specially crafted links on the page to associate with a video, turning them into a playlist.

playlistLoop.description: If set to true and this video has a playlist, it will loop back to the first video after the last one has finished.

playsinline.description: If set to false, videos will play within the native mobile player.

playPauseNotifier.description: If set to false, animations for the Pause and Play symbols will be removed.

playSuspendedOffScreen.description: If set to false for a muted autoplay video, the video won't pause when out of view.

clickToPlayButton.description: If set to false, removes the “Click to Play” button on video thumbnails.

preload.description: Sets the video’s preload property. Possible values are metadata, auto, none, true, and false.

qualityControl.description: If set to false, the video quality selector in the settings menu will be hidden.

qualityMax.description: Specifies the maximum quality the video will play at.

qualityMin.description: Specifies the minimum quality the video will play at.

resumable.description: Determines if the video should resume from where the viewer left off. Options are true, false, and auto.

seo.description: If set to true, the video’s metadata will be injected into the page’s markup for SEO.

settingsControl.description: If set to true, the settings control will be available.

silentAutoPlay.description: Determines how videos handle autoplay in contexts where normal autoplay might be blocked. Options are true, allow, and false.

stillUrl.description: Overrides the thumbnail image that appears before the video plays.

time.description: Sets the starting time of the video.

thumbnailAltText.description: Sets the Thumbnail Alt Text for the media.

videoFoam.description: When set to true, the video will adjust its size according to its parent element. It can also be an object specifying min/max width or height.

minWidth.description: Minimum width the video can be resized to.

maxWidth.description: Maximum width the video can be resized to.

minHeight.description: Minimum height the video can be resized to.

maxHeight.description: Maximum height the video can be resized to.

volume.description: Sets the volume of the video.

volumeControl.description: When set to true, a volume control is available over the video.

wmode.description: If set to transparent, the background behind the player will be transparent instead of black.

playerColor.description: The color of the video player.

autoPlay.description: Whether the video should auto play or not.

endVideoBehavior.description: Behavior of the video at the end.

playButton.description: Indicates if the play button is visible.

error.description: Error message detailing the reason for the bad request.

put.description: Allows for partial updates on a video’s customizations. If a value is null, then that key will be deleted from the saved customizations. If it is not null, that value will be set.

parameters.name: media-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the video to be customized.

autoPlay.description: If set to true, the video will play as soon as it’s ready. Note that autoplay might not work on some devices and browsers.

controlsVisibleOnLoad.description: If set to true, controls like the big play button, playbar, volume, etc. will be visible as soon as the video is embedded.

copyLinkAndThumbnailEnabled.description: If set to false, the option to “Copy Link and Thumbnail” will be removed when right-clicking on the video.

doNotTrack.description: If set to true, data for each viewing session will not be tracked.

email.description: Associate a specific email address with this video’s viewing sessions.

endVideoBehavior.description: Determines what happens when the video ends. Options are default (stays on the last frame), reset (shows thumbnail and controls), and loop (plays again from the start).

fakeFullscreen.description: If set to true, the video will try to play in a pseudo-fullscreen mode on certain mobile devices.

fitStrategy.description: Resizes the video when there's a discrepancy between its aspect ratio and that of its parent container. Options are contain, cover, fill, and none.

fullscreenButton.description: If set to true, the fullscreen button will be available as a video control.

fullscreenOnRotateToLandscape.description: If set to false, the video will not automatically go to fullscreen mode on mobile when rotated to landscape.

keyMoments.description: If set to false, the key moments feature will be disabled.

muted.description: If set to true, the video will start in a muted state.

playbackRateControl.description: If set to false, the playback speed controls in the settings menu will be hidden.

playbar.description: If set to true, the playbar will be available. If set to false, it will be hidden.

playButton.description: Indicates if the play button is visible.

playerColor.description: Changes the base color of the player. Expects a hexadecimal rgb string.

playlistLinks.description: Enables the use of specially crafted links on the page to associate with a video, turning them into a playlist.

playlistLoop.description: If set to true and this video has a playlist, it will loop back to the first video after the last one has finished.

playsinline.description: If set to false, videos will play within the native mobile player.

playPauseNotifier.description: If set to false, animations for the Pause and Play symbols will be removed.

playSuspendedOffScreen.description: If set to false for a muted autoplay video, the video won't pause when out of view.

clickToPlayButton.description: If set to false, removes the “Click to Play” button on video thumbnails.

preload.description: Sets the video’s preload property. Possible values are metadata, auto, none, true, and false.

qualityControl.description: If set to false, the video quality selector in the settings menu will be hidden.

qualityMax.description: Specifies the maximum quality the video will play at.

qualityMin.description: Specifies the minimum quality the video will play at.

resumable.description: Determines if the video should resume from where the viewer left off. Options are true, false, and auto.

seo.description: If set to true, the video’s metadata will be injected into the page’s markup for SEO.

settingsControl.description: If set to true, the settings control will be available.

silentAutoPlay.description: Determines how videos handle autoplay in contexts where normal autoplay might be blocked. Options are true, allow, and false.

stillUrl.description: Overrides the thumbnail image that appears before the video plays.

time.description: Sets the starting time of the video.

thumbnailAltText.description: Sets the Thumbnail Alt Text for the media.

videoFoam.description: When set to true, the video will adjust its size according to its parent element. It can also be an object specifying min/max width or height.

minWidth.description: Minimum width the video can be resized to.

maxWidth.description: Maximum width the video can be resized to.

minHeight.description: Minimum height the video can be resized to.

maxHeight.description: Maximum height the video can be resized to.

volume.description: Sets the volume of the video.

volumeControl.description: When set to true, a volume control is available over the video.

wmode.description: If set to transparent, the background behind the player will be transparent instead of black.

playerColor.description: The color of the video player.

autoPlay.description: Whether the video should auto play or not.

endVideoBehavior.description: Behavior of the video at the end.

playButton.description: Indicates if the play button is visible.

delete.description: Deletes all explicit customizations for a video, making it act as if it has never been customized.

parameters.name: media-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media whose customizations are to be deleted.

get.description:
Returns all the captions associated with a specified video.
If captions do not exist for this video, the response will be an empty JSON array.
If this video does not exist, the response will be an empty HTTP 404 Not Found.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media for which captions are to be retrieved.

language.description: A 3 character language code as specified by ISO-639–2.

text.description: The text of the captions for the specified language in SRT format.

post.description: Adds captions to a specified video by providing an SRT file or its contents directly.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media for which captions are to be added.

caption_file.description: Either an attached SRT file or a string parameter with the contents of an SRT file.

language.description: An optional parameter that denotes which language this file represents. Should conform to ISO-639–2. If left unspecified, the language code will be detected automatically.

400.description: Captions already exist for this video

get.description: Returns a video's captions in the specified language and in SRT format.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media from which captions are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: language-code
parameters.description: The language code of the captions to be retrieved.

200.description: Successful response containing captions in SRT format

language.description: A 3 character language code as specified by ISO-639–2.

text.description: The text of the captions for the specified language in SRT format.

404.description: Captions not found or video not found

put.description: This method is for replacing the captions on a video for the specified language.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the video.

parameters.name: language-code
parameters.description: Language code conforming to ISO-639-2 for which the captions should be updated.

caption_file.description: Either an attached SRT file or a string parameter with the contents of an SRT file.

delete.description: This method is for removing the captions file from a video for the specified language.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the video.

parameters.name: language-code
parameters.description: Language code conforming to ISO-639-2 for which the captions should be removed.

get.description: Returns a video's captions in the specified language and in VTT format.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media from which captions are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: language-code
parameters.description: The language code of the captions to be retrieved.

200.description: Successful response containing captions in VTT format

404.description: Captions not found or video not found

get.description: Returns a video's captions in the specified language and in TXT format.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media from which captions are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: language-code
parameters.description: The language code of the captions to be retrieved.

200.description: Successful response containing captions in TXT format

404.description: Captions not found or video not found

post.description: This method is for purchasing English captions for a video. The request will charge the credit card on the account if successful. A saved credit card is required to use this endpoint.

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the video.

automated.description: Order computer-generated captions (free) or human-generated captions ($2.50/minute).

rush.description: Enable rush order for one business day turnaround ($4.00/minute) or standard four business day turnaround for human-generated captions ($2.50/minute). Rush can only be used for human-generated captions.

automatically_enable.description: Automatically enable captions for the video once the order is ready or hold the captions for review before manually enabling.

400.description: English captions already exist for this video.

post.description: Creates a new media that trims off parts of an existing media

parameters.name: media-hashed-id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the media.

trims.description: An array of strings matching the format of HH:MM:SS.mmm-HH:MM:SS.mmm where HH is hours, MM is minutes, SS is seconds and mmm is milliseconds. The ranges should contain the earliest point of the trim first and the later point of the trim second.

id.description: The ID of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

status.description: The status of the background job that’s been queued for the request.

422.description: Unprocessible entity, parameters provided were invalid.

errors.description: Contains a summary of what fields had errors and the errors they had.

get.description: Use this endpoint to request a list of Tags in your Wistia account. This request supports paging and sorting.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of tags per page

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Ordering

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Ordering Sort Direction (0 = desc, 1 = asc)

taggingsCount.description: The number of different medias that have been associated with this tag.

created.description: The date that the tag was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the tag was last updated.

taggingsCount.description: The number of different medias that have been associated with this tag.

created.description: The date that the tag was originally created.

updated.description: The date that the tag was last updated.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Tag ID

schema.description: Name of the tag to delete

get.description: Returns all the Channels associated with the account.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of channels per page

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Ordering. Default is ID ASC.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Ordering Sort Direction (0 = desc, 1 = asc; default is 1)

parameters.name: hashed_ids[]
parameters.description: Find all of the channels limited to these hashed_ids.

created.description: The date when the channel was originally created.

hashedId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this channel.

mediaCount.description: The number of medias in the channel.

name.description: The display name for the channel

updated.description: The date when the channel was last updated.

get.description: Returns the Channel associated with the hashedId.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The hashed ID of the channel.

created.description: The date when the channel was originally created.

hashedId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this channel.

mediaCount.description: The number of medias in the channel.

name.description: The display name for the channel

updated.description: The date when the channel was last updated.

get.description: Returns all the Channel Episodes associated with the account, and allows for filtering by a particular channel.

parameters.name: channel_id
parameters.description: Find episodes for a particular channel by providing the channel hashed ID

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Ordering. Default is ID ASC.

parameters.name: sort_direction
parameters.description: Ordering Sort Direction (0 = desc, 1 = asc; default is 1)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of channels per page

parameters.name: media_id
parameters.description: Filter by media id

parameters.name: hashed_id
parameters.description: Filter by hashed id

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Filter by published status.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter by channel episode name/title.

channelHashedId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the channel episode's channel.

created.description: The date when the channel episode was originally created.

hashedId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the channel episode.

mediaHashedId.description: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the channel episode's media.

published.description: Whether the channel episode has been published or is still in draft form.

title.description: The title of the channel episode

updated.description: The date when the channel was last updated.
